content.body: annevk: following up on your `fetchLater` comments, I don't know how to go about the thing about potentially trustworthy URLs
content.formatted_body: annevk: following up on your fetchLater comments, I don't know how to go about the thing about potentially trustworthy URLs

content.body: annevk: I can't handle it in the network layer, as the error has to be thrown synchronously. What I want to do here is allow HTTPS+localhost-ish URLs for `fetchLater` but nothing else... is that not possible to do synchronously? I didn't get why this was related to mixed content
content.formatted_body: annevk: I can't handle it in the network layer, as the error has to be thrown synchronously. What I want to do here is allow HTTPS+localhost-ish URLs for fetchLater but nothing else... is that not possible to do synchronously? I didn't get why this was related to mixed content

content.body: Noam Rosenthal: okay, disregard that comment in that case; that's not quite the same as a Mixed Content check
content.formatted_body: Noam Rosenthal: okay, disregard that comment in that case; that's not quite the same as a Mixed Content check

content.body: I wish we had a better term than "potentially trustworthy"

annevk: great. so I think everything else is fixed. Regarding the parameter name: `activationTimeout` seems like the wrong term, and it's pretty flexible to. be an `activationDeadline`. How about `activationDelay`?
content.formatted_body: annevk: great. so I think everything else is fixed. Regarding the parameter name: activationTimeout seems like the wrong term, and it's pretty flexible to. be an activationDeadline. How about activationDelay?
